text: Lieutenant General Raj Mohan Vohra, PVSM, MVC (7 May 193214 June 2020) was a General Officer of the Indian Army. He was awarded the Maha Vir Chakra for his leadership in the Battle of Basantar during the Indo-Pakistani War of 1971. He was born in Shimla, Himachal Pradesh. Vohra died on 14 June 2020 from COVID-19, aged 88.Fallen warrior: A final farewell ==References== Category:2020 deaths Category:1932 births Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in New Delhi Category:Indian generals Category:People from Himachal Pradesh
title: Raj Mohan Vohra
